page.title: 19Changes in Brookmans Park
page.content: We interviewed several people who live in or near Brookmans Park and the interesting thing was that we were told the same by all of them. The village and its surroundings have not changed a lot since they have lived here. One couple who have lived here the longest, Mr and Mrs King, told us that the cottage they live in used to belong to Mrs King's father and it was a pig farm. Mrs King is now in her seventies and the pig farm is just a collection of disused outhouses. She showed us old survey maps of the area around Bell Bar and how the large estate has been divided up and sold. Bell Bar used to have a post office but this is now a private house.Some of the land, which used to be farmed has now become a market garden and a garden centre but the land is still basically used for agriculture.
